definition[0]: to change the way in which something such as a government, business, or system is organized
example[0]: proposals to radically restructure Britainâ€™s electronics industry
definition[1]: if a company restructures, or someone restructures it, it changes the way it is organized or financed
example[1]: The iron ore company has restructured its operations.
example[2]: The group will restructure, reducing the workforce by as much as 19%.
definition[2]: if a company restructures its debts, it makes an agreement with lenders to pay the debts in a different way to the one agreed before
example[3]: The troubled department store failed to make scheduled interest payments and faces bank demands that it restructure its debt.
